messages.subject: Re: chuck e cheese's free tokens for report cards
messages.msgSnippet: Well...I plan on using them tomorrow so I ll let you know how it goes.  We ve never been to a chuckecheese before (none around us but tomorrow we re going on a
messages.messageBody:
Well...I plan on using them tomorrow so I'll let you know how it
goes. We've never been to a chuckecheese before (none around us but
tomorrow we're going on a trip and there's one on the way) so the
kids are VERY excited.


Sheila


--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, "zenmomma2kids"
<zenmomma@h...> wrote:
> >> The teacher supply stores near us sell report cards for less
than
> a dollar. It would be simple to type/print in a school name and
fill
> in the blanks. Seems the most "official" looking to me and least
> likely to cause any glares. >>
>
> Oh I'm not afraid of their glares.At 43, I'm probably old enough to
> be the mother of most of the people working at Chuck e Cheese's
> anyway. I'll have that air of authority all on my own. <g> Besides,
I
> look forward to enlightening them about homeschooling/unschooling.
> They'll never know what hit 'em.
>
> Life is good.
> ~Mary, the subversive

messages.subject: Re: chuck e cheese's free tokens for report cards
messages.msgSnippet: ... a dollar. It would be simple to type/print in a school name and fill in the blanks. Seems the most official looking to me and least likely to cause any
messages.messageBody:
>> The teacher supply stores near us sell report cards for less than
a dollar. It would be simple to type/print in a school name and fill
in the blanks. Seems the most "official" looking to me and least
likely to cause any glares. >>

Oh I'm not afraid of their glares.At 43, I'm probably old enough to
be the mother of most of the people working at Chuck e Cheese's
anyway. I'll have that air of authority all on my own. <g> Besides, I
look forward to enlightening them about homeschooling/unschooling.
They'll never know what hit 'em.

Life is good.
~Mary, the subversive

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: chuck e cheese's free tokens for report cards
messages.msgSnippet: The teacher supply stores near us sell report cards for less than a dollar. It would be simple to type/print in a school name and fill in the blanks. Seems the
messages.messageBody:
The teacher supply stores near us sell report cards for less than a dollar.
It would be simple to type/print in a school name and fill in the blanks.
Seems the most "official" looking to me and least likely to cause any
glares. LOL, you could even use different inks and make it look like you've
been using it for a while!

Just a thought!
Jennifer

messages.subject: Re: chuck e cheese's free tokens for report cards
messages.msgSnippet: ... paper printed off of the computer that says ... I haven t actually done it yet. We were just in the discussion stage the other day. If I do, I ll just put
messages.messageBody:
>> What kind of report card did you make up? Will they accept just a
paper printed off of the computer that says
>
> Report card
>
> Math A
> Reading A
> Art A

I haven't actually done it yet. We were just in the discussion stage
the other day. If I do, I'll just put a homeschool name on it (our
current is Barking Dog Free School) and give them some subjects and
grades like you listed. I figure they'll accept what I give them.

Life is good.
~Mary

messages.subject: Re: chuck e cheese's free tokens for report cards
messages.msgSnippet: What kind of report card did you make up?  Will they accept just a paper printed off of the computer that says Report card Math A Reading A Art A etc. Sheila
messages.messageBody:
What kind of report card did you make up? Will they accept just a
paper printed off of the computer that says

Report card

Math A
Reading A
Art A
etc.

Sheila

--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, "zenmomma2kids"
<zenmomma@h...> wrote:
> >> Has anyone ever made up a report card for their kids so that
they
> can get free tokens at chuckecheese's? >>
>
> LOL! Casey *just* asked me to do this for her. The kids are sitting
> here right now debating whether it would be "cheating" or not. I
told
> them that IMHO they've done just fine learning everything they set
> out to learn this year. That's worth all A's in my book.
>
> Life is good.
> ~Mary

messages.subject: Re: chuck e cheese's free tokens for report cards
messages.msgSnippet: ... can get free tokens at chuckecheese s?   LOL! Casey *just* asked me to do this for her. The kids are sitting here right now debating whether it would be
messages.messageBody:
>> Has anyone ever made up a report card for their kids so that they
can get free tokens at chuckecheese's? >>

LOL! Casey *just* asked me to do this for her. The kids are sitting
here right now debating whether it would be "cheating" or not. I told
them that IMHO they've done just fine learning everything they set
out to learn this year. That's worth all A's in my book.

Life is good.
~Mary

messages.subject: chuck e cheese's free tokens for report cards
